chapter.title: Remote Installation from a Network Server
chapter.para: For detailed information about installing &sls; from a network server in general, see the &deploy;, Chapter 14, Remote Installation.
The following section provides a short description about installing from a network server.

sect1.title: Installing with Installation Media from the Network

step.para: Copy the &sles4sap; DVD content to a Web server (e.g., example.com) to the directory /srv/www/htdocs/mydir.

Choose one of the boot menu options and edit the command line: remove the parameter instmode=cd from the command line and change netsetup=0 to netsetup=1 and autoyast=file:/// to autoyast=http://example.com/mydir/, and add the parameter install=http://example.com/mydir.

sect1.para: This is all you need for a network installation. If you want to avoid using a DVD to bootstrap the system and boot from the network via PXE, read the SLES &ay; documentation about setting up a PXE environment.

sect1.title: Installing from an NFS Server with the Installation Wizard
sect1.para: If you want to put the SAP media on an NFS Server, proceed as follows:

step.para: Create a directory /srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo on your installation server.
Edit the /etc/exports file on the installation server by adding the following:
In /srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo create a directory for every SAP media you have, for example sapcd_1, sapcd_2, etc.
Copy the content of all SAP media to the corresponding directory.

sect1.para: Now you can install from the NFS server.
